explanations.summary: K+ excretion mainly via SECRETION in distal tubule and collecting duct (principal cells). Aldosterone enhances this. Proximal tubule reabsorbs ~65% of filtered K+, but secretion in distal nephron determines final excretion.

whyCorrect.b: Increased K+ excretion is primarily due to increased SECRETION by principal cells in distal tubule and collecting duct. High K+ diet → aldosterone → more K+ channels/pumps → more secretion.

whyIncorrect.a: Decreased reabsorption is minor factor; secretion is key.
whyIncorrect.c: High K+ diet INCREASES aldosterone (to excrete more K+).
whyIncorrect.d: GFR changes are not the main mechanism for K+ adaptation.
whyIncorrect.e: PT reabsorption is relatively constant; distal secretion varies.
